result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Derek Wayne Gokee was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Derek Wayne Gokee was found guilty of Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Case called. Judge Harrington appears by video. Defendant Derek Wayne Gokee in court with attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All parties have received PSI packet. No corrections or additions by either party.
State addresses court, recommends 18 months initial confinement followed by 24 months supervision.
Atty Kirkpatrick addresses court, requests Court to follow recommendation of 1 year county jail.  DEF addresses court. 
Court addresses parties. Court is satisfied DOC report is appropriate. Court imposes 360 days county jail, Huber and Good Time authorized, stipulated credit for 140 days.   Def. must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $ 250 surcharge if not already done.  Firearm restriction. Voter restriction.    Convert DOC Collect Judgment to Clerk of Court Unpaid Fine Judgment - for same fines/court costs and restitution if applicable.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on November 14, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Derek Wayne Gokee, in custody, in court with attorney Christopher Stephen Petros.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation has been revoked.
Atty Petros states DE has requested new counsel.  Court orders PSI and directs Atty Petros to notify Public Defenders office to obtain new counsel for DE. 
Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for November 14, 2017 at 01:00 pm.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on September 21, 2017 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Derek Wayne Gokee in court with attorney Stephen Zuber.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  DEF pleads No Contest to Counts #1 & #3.  DEF found Guilty of both charges.  

Ct #1:  Sentence imposed.    The defendant shall serve 9 months in home detention/electronic monitoring pursuant to section 973.03(4), to be monitored by the STOP program.  Credit for 3 days time served.  Fine $2500 plus costs.  DL revoked 30 months plus 9 months.    AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations, Attend Victim Impact Panel and maintain compliance with driver safety plan.  IID On any vehicle owned or operated 30 months.    Def. must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $ 250 surcharge.
Ct #2 is dismissed.
Ct #3:  Sentence withheld, DEF placed on 2 years probation.    Complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent.   $100 fine plus costs totalling $654.    complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent.    Def. must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $ 250 surcharge.  DL revoked 6 months, concurrent with count #1.

APPEARANCES:  John Yackel appeared for the State.  DE appeared in person.

State still waiting on blood results.

Court set $750.00 cash bond, with conditions:

SPECIAL BOND Conditions with Random Testing
1. Defendant shall not consume any intoxicating beverages.
2. Defendant shall not enter the premises of any business that sells or serves alcoholic beverages by the drink.
3. Defendant shall be subject to RANDOM TESTING if his/her blood, breath or urine, and shall report to the Sawyer County Human Services Department at 10610 Main Street, Hayward, WI (ph. 715-638-3317) within 48 hours upon release from custody (not counting weekends and holidays) to schedule an intake session with the Sawyer County Traffic Offender Program (STOP) and to establish the procedures for the random testing. FAILURE TO REPORT TO STOP PROGRAM MAY RESULT IN THE ISSUANCE OF A WARRANT FOR THE DEFENDANT'S ARREST, MODIFICATION OF BAIL, POSSIBLE BAIL JUMPING CHARGES, AND/OR FORFEITURE OF BAIL.
